What are the symptoms of avian influenza?

The symptoms of avian influenza are similar to those of other types of influenza. They include fever, cough, sore throat, muscle aches, and headache. In more severe cases, avian influenza can cause severe respiratory illness and other complications.
How does avian influenza spread?
Avian influenza spreads from birds to humans through direct or indirect contact with infected birds or contaminated environments. It is not spread through human-to-human contact.
Can avian influenza be treated?
Yes, antiviral medications can be used to treat avian influenza, but they work best when started within the first 2 days of symptoms. Vaccines are also available for some subtypes of avian influenza.
